spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 24}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 24}), requiring no material components:

trait.name: Alien Mind
entries: If a creature tries to read the Warlocks's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Create Thrall
entries: The Warlock can infect a creature's mind and body with the alien magic of his patron. As a bonus action the Warlock touch an {@condition unconscious} humanoid or beast. The creature is transformed into the splitting image of the warlock, its statistics become the {@creature Warlock of the Great Old One|VGM} and is immune to {@condition Exhaustion}, following the Warlock's commands and will.
The creature remains in this form until it falls to 0 hit points or fall {@condition unconscious}.
This effect can be ended with a {@spell dispel magic} spell {@dc 19}, the creature then falls {@condition unconscious} with 0 hit points.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The warlock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a bonus action, the warlock can surround himself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the warlock takes 10 poison damage.
The aura lasts until the warlock dismiss it with a bonus action.

trait.name: Hex Mastery
entries: The warlock is a master of torment. When he casts the {@spell hex} spell and on each subsequent turn as a bonus action. As long as the hex target is withing 30 feet, the warlock can teleport to a unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.
Alternatively the warlock can cause the cursed target within 30 feet and any other creature within 5 feet of it suffer 10 psychic damage.

trait.name: Eldritch Mastery
entries: When the warlock casts the {@spell eldritch blast} cantrip he adds his Charisma modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.
Additionally when the warlock hits a creature with this cantrip he can push or pull the target 10 feets away or towards from him.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warlock casts a spell and makes two shadow scythe attacks.

action.name: Shadow Scythe
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) psychic damage. If the target is in dim light or darkness this attack has advantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The knight has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: When the knight uses his action to cast a spell he can use his bonus action to make a weapon attack.

trait.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: When the knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, the creature has disadvantage on its next spell save until the end of the knight's next turn.

trait.name: Shield Master
entries: If the knight is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage and he is wearing his shield, the knight instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Arms Bond
entries: The knight has a bond with his weapons, shield and armor and can't be disarmed unless he is {@condition incapacitated}.
As a bonus action the knight can materialize and wear his armor, shield and weapon.

trait.name: Arcane Action Surge (2 uses recharges with a short or long rest)
entries: The knight can push himself beyond his normal limits for a moment. On your turn, he can take one additional action.
Additionally when he uses this feature he can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. He can teleport before or after he takes the additional action.

trait.name: Indomitable  (3 uses recharges with a short or long rest)
entries: The knight can reroll a saving throw he fails, keeping the second roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight can make four longsword or greatsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, or 19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When the knight uses his reaction to make an opportunity attack against a target, he can cast a spell on it instead. The spell must have a casting time of  1 action and must target only that creature.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Autolycus spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Limited Divination Immunity
entries: The Autolycus can't be affected, detected by divination magic unless it wishes to be. Including natural truesight.

trait.name: Silent walker
entries: Autolycus is always under the effect of a {@spell Pass without Trace} spell.

trait.name: King's Hoard
entries: As a bonus action. Autolycus can send any object he carrying to a demiplane. He can also retrieve an object previously sent there.

trait.name: Reliable
entries: Autolycus has advantage on all ability checks.

trait.name: Honour Among Thieves
entries: If a creature tries to steal or take a item belonging to Autolycus, it must first succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails it feels demotivated to do so and give up.

action.name: Identity Theft
entries: Autolycus tries to steal a large or smaller creature's appearance. A creature within 5 feet must succeed a {@dc 27} charisma saving throw or Autolycus becomes the splitting image of the target, with the same voice, smell, weight, etc. Until he dismisses this  effect (no action required).

action.name: Speed Snatch
entries: Autolycus tries to steal a creature's speed. A creature within 5 feet must succeed a {@dc 27} charisma saving throw or have one of its special speed stolen (climbing, swimming, borrowing) for 1 minute or until Autolycus snatches another creature's speed.
The creature's speed becomes 0 and Autolycus adds the stolen speed to his own.

action.name: Steal Senses
entries: Autolycus tries to steal a creature's senses. A creature within 5 feet must succeed a {@dc 27} charisma saving throw or have one of its senses stolen.
The target loses one of its senses permanently. It can be restored by a {@spell greater restoration} spell.
Autolycus gains the creature's senses for 24 hours.

action.name: Lifesteal
entries: Autolycus tries to steal a creature's temporary hit points. A creature within 5 feet must succeed a {@dc 27} charisma saving throw or lose all of its temporary hit points.
Autolycus gains temporary hit points equal to the lost by the target.

reaction.name: Spell Theft
entries: Immediately after a creature casts a spell that targets or include Autolycus or any other creature it can see, he can use his reaction to force the caster to make a {@dc 27} saving throw with its spellcasting ability modifier. If it fails the spell is negated, the slot is spent and the creature loses the knowledge of the spell for 8 hours, becoming unable to cast it.
Autolycus can cast this spell once without spending a spell slot.

trait.name: Archer's Eye
entries: As a bonus action, the archer can add {@dice 1d12} to its next attack or damage roll with a longbow or shortbow.

trait.name: Poisoned Weapons
entries: The archer's weapon attacks are magical. When the archer hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d6} poison damage. This poison ignores resistances.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes three attacks with its longbow or shortsword.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.
Archers defend castles, hunt wild game on the fringes of civilization, serve as artillery in military units, and occasionally make good coin as brigands or caravan guards.

spellcasting.name: Innate spellcasting
headerEntries: This dragon can innately cast five spells, once per day each, requiring no material components. Each spell's level can be no higher than 5th. The dragon's spell save DC is 18, and it has +10 to hit with spell attacks.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Blind Senses
entries: The dragon ignores the sight requirement of spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Cold Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 58 ({@damage 13d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Paralyzing Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

reaction.name: Blind Rebuke
entries: When the dragon suffers damage caused by a creature within his blindsight range he can make an attack, cast a spell or use his breath weapon (if available) targeting the creature.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon uses his breath weapon.

legendary.name: Inhale
entries: The dragon recharges his breath.

spellcasting.name: Facemelter Sword
headerEntries: The facemelter sword can be used to cast (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The wielder of the facemelter can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the facemelter's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The facemelter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The facemelter uses Poison Mind. It also makes two attacks: one with its Facemelter and one with its Disruptive Touch.

action.name: Facemelter
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage.

action.name: Disruptive Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Poison Mind
entries: The facemelter targets one or two creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 4d12}) necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of the facemelter's next turn.

action.name: Forgetfulness {@recharge}
entries: The facemelter targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw and on a failure the target is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A {@condition stunned} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target remains {@condition stunned} for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Felinto is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). Felinto has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Bolstering Presence
entries: Felinto magically emanates life-giving energy within 30 feet of itself. Any ally of the biomancer that starts its turn there regains 11 ({@dice 2d10}) hit points.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Felinto has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Felinto can cast a spell of 1st level or higher and a cantrip.
He can switch either of the spells for a Vampiric Touch.

action.name: Eldritch Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 300/300 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force damage. The target can be pushed 10 feet and has its speed reduced by 10 feet.

action.name: Vampiric Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. And recover half of the damage dealt.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
entries: In response to taking damage, Felinto turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke
entries: Felinto uses {@spell hellish rebuke}

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The guardian is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The guardian has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The guardian casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

trait.name: King's Ultra Greatsword.
entries: Gwyn's weapon attacks are magical. When Gwyn attacks with his weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 8d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The gwyn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the gwyn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Light Absorption
entries: Whenever the gwyn is subjected to lightning, fire or radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: Gwyn can make up to 3 attacks with his greatsword and sunlight spears.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage, plus 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Sunlight Spear
entries: Gwyn manifests a spear of pure sunlight into his hand and hurls it at an enemy. One target within 120 feet must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Blinding Light
entries: When Gwyn is attacked by a creature within 30 feet of him, he can use his reaction to emit light, blinding any creature within 30 feet of him until the start of Gwyn's next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Gwyn makes a greatsword attack or uses his sunlight spear.

legendary.name: Hail Of Spears
entries: Gwyn calls down a hundred spears made of pure lightning from the heavens. All creatures within 20 feet must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Soul Of Light (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Gwyn emanates pure sunlight from his body, burning others while healing himself. Each creature within 10 feet must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Gwyn then recovers hit points equal to the amount of damage dealt. In addition Gwyn emits 60 feet of bright light until his next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellasting
headerEntries: The ranger's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Distant Strike
entries: On his turn the ranger can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space he can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ranger has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ranger's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ranger makes three longbow attacks.

action.name: Longbow - Vine Arrow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by vines that burst our of the arrow and take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turn.

action.name: Longbow -  Force Arrow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h} 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) force damage. This attack ignores cover and strong wind.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The enchanter is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: _Confusing Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of Izor and is able to see the Izor's eyes, Izor can magically force it to make a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw, unless the Izor is {@condition incapacitated}.

On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the Izor until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the Izor in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: _Split Enchantment
entries: When Izor casts a enchantment spell of 1st level or higher, that targets only one creature, he can have it target a second creature.

trait.name: _Alter Memories
entries: When Izor casts a enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, he can alter the creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being {@condition charmed}.

Additionally, once before the spell expires, Izor can use his action to make the chosen creature forget some of the time it spent {@condition charmed}. The creature must succeed on an {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw or lose up to 4 hours, limited to the enchantment spell duration.

trait.name: _Smooth Enchanter
entries: Izor's spells that Charm a creature do not confer advantage even if he or his allies are fighting it.
Additionally if a creature tries to read Izor's mind, it must succeed a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by him for 24 hours.

trait.name: _Enchantment Immunity
entries: Izor is immune to Enchantment spells.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Izor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: _Spell Mastery
entries: Izor can cast {@spell charm person} and {@spell hold person} at will.

action.name: Psychic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h} 27 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharges after the Enchanter Casts an Enchantment Spell of 1st level or Higher)
entries: The enchanter tries to magically divert an attack made against it, provided that the attacker is within 30 feet of it and visible to it. The enchanter must decide to do so before the attack hits or misses.

The attacker must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature closest to it, other than the enchanter or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: Izor casts a spell of 3rd level or lower.

legendary.name: Psychic Blast
entries: Izor uses Psychic Blast.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kiralei's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kiralei is a 14th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Poison Absorption
entries: Whenever Kiralei is subjected to poison damage, she takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the poison damage dealt.
Additionally when Kiralei is subject to a poison that requires a Saving Throw she can choose to fail it.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Kiralei has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Kiralei to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Kiralei has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pontent Poisons
entries: Kiralei's poisons ignore resistances. If a creature tries to remove the poison it must succeed on a ability check with its spellcasting ability {@dc 19}.
Additionally whenever Kiralei's poisons causes damage on a creature that is immune to poison it causes necrotic damage instead.

trait.name: Infuse Poison
entries: As a bonus action Kiralei infuses her hands with dark energy, choosing one of the following effects to affect any creature she touches {@dc 19}.

{@i 1. Truth Serum} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. The {@condition poisoned} creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a {@spell zone of truth} spell.

{@i 2. Carrion Poison} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

{@i 3. Dark Poison} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious}  while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

{@i 4. Burning Breath} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The creature repeats the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. Damage caused by this poison doesn't causes a creature to wake up or end effects that would normally be ended by damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kiralei makes two poison touch or gentle touch attacks.

action.name: Poison Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) poison damage. The target is subject to one of Kiralei's infused poisons.

action.name: Gentle Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. The target is subject to one of Kiralei's infused poisons and makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

legendary.name: Poison (or Gentle) Touch
entries: Kiralei uses her Poison Touch or Gentle Touch.

legendary.name: Cast lower Spells
entries: Kiralei casts a spell of level 1-3.

legendary.name: Cast Greater Spells (2 Actions)
entries: Kiralei casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kiralei's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 21}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kiralei is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Poison Absorption
entries: Whenever Kiralei is subjected to poison damage, she takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the poison damage dealt.
Additionally when Kiralei is subject to a poison that requires a Saving Throw she can choose to fail it.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Kiralei has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Kiralei to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Kiralei has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Everlasting Poisons
entries: Kiralei's poisons ignore resistances and lasts until cured. If a creature tries to remove the poison it must succeed on a ability check with its spellcasting ability {@dc 19}.
Additionally whenever Kiralei's poisons causes damage on a creature that is immune to poison it causes necrotic damage instead.

trait.name: Infuse Poison
entries: As a bonus action Kiralei infuses her hands with dark energy, choosing one of the following effects to affect any creature she touches {@dc 21}.

{@i 1. Truth Serum} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a {@spell zone of truth} spell.

{@i 2. Carrion Poison} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

{@i 3. Dark Poison} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious}  while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

{@i 4. Burning Breath} The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The creature repeats the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. Damage caused by this poison doesn't causes a creature to wake up or end effects that would normally be ended by damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kiralei makes two poison touch or gentle touch attacks.

action.name: Poison Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) poison damage. The target is subject to one of Kiralei's infused poisons.

action.name: Gentle Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. The target is subject to one of Kiralei's infused poisons and makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

legendary.name: Poison (or Gentle) Touch
entries: Kiralei uses her Poison Touch or Gentle Touch.

legendary.name: Cast lower Spells
entries: Kiralei casts a spell.

trait.name: Mana Storage
entries: The beast can store up to 9 charges of mana in its crystals. The crystals have  AC 20, 200 hit points, resistance to all damage. immunity to psychic. If the crystals are destroyed the Beast loses all immunity and become vulnerable to all types of damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Beast long jump is up to 50 feet and its high jump is up to 25 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The beast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Bound
entries: The beast is bound to a location (a fortress, castle, cave) and can't leave or be forced out of it by any means.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beast makes five attacks: four claw attacks and one swallow or bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8})  slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. On hit: the target is swallowed.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The beast swallows a large or smaller creature that it is grappling. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the beast.

At the end of the beasts turn the creatures inside it has their vital energy drained, charging the beast crystals by ({@dice 1d6 + 3}). Each creature inside the beast must roll a hit dice for each charge the beast has drained, taking that as damage to their maximum hit points, this damage can't be reduced by any means, a creature that gets reduced to 0 maximum hit points has it body destroyed and dies.
If the beast takes 60 or more damage in a single turn from creatures inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or regurgitate all creatures it has swallowed.

action.name: Supercharged Beam
entries: When the beast's crystals are fully charged it can shoot a powerful 120-feet-long 20-feet-wide beam. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw taking {@damage 10d10 + 60} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the save and is reduced to 0 hit points dies and its body and possessions (except magic items) are destroyed. The beam also destroys any object in its path.

action.name: Inhale {@recharge 6}
entries: The beast open its mouths and inhales with tremendous strength. Each creature in 90-feet-long 20-foot-wide line makes a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw being pulled 15 feet towards the beast on a successful save, or be pulled 30 feet and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. Flying creatures makes the save with disadvantage.
Additionally a creature that is {@condition prone} and get within 5 feet of the beast during Inhale, gets swallowed.

reaction.name: Magic Absorption
entries: When the beast is the target or is in the area of a spell it can use it's reaction to nullify it and absorb its energy, gaining mana charges equal to the spell's level.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The beast makes a Bite, Swallow or Claw attack.

legendary.name: Powerful Healing
entries: The beast consumes all of its charges restoring 40 hit points per charge.

legendary.name: Empowered Blast
entries: The beast consumes all of its charges shooting a blast of force at a target. The target makes {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw taking {@damage 10d10} +10 (per charge) force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Supercharged Beam (3 actions)
entries: The beast uses its Supercharged Beam.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the sun monk is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the sun monk instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Step of the Wind
entries: The monk can take the Disengage or Dash actions as a bonus action.

trait.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: The monk can use his bonus action to makes two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Monk makes three unarmed strikes and uses his quivering palm (if available).

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the monk can cause one of the following effects:
The creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (monk's choice).
The creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the monk.
The creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the monk's next turn.

action.name: Quivering Palm {@recharge 6}
entries: When the monk hits a creature with an unarmed strike it can force the target to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is reduced to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Wholeness of Body (Recharges after a Long Rest).
entries: The monk regains 60 hit points.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the monk deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 25}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the monk catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the monk has a hand free.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Whisperer acolyte's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit). The whisperer can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the whisperer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Corrosive Poison
entries: The whisperer's poisons ignores resistances. If a target is immune to poison, it takes acid damage instead.

trait.name: Poisoned weapons
entries: The whisperer's weapon attacks are magical. When the whisperer hits with any weapon, the weapon deals {@dice 6d6} extra poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whisperer makes three attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The whisperer exhales poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 77 ({@damage 22d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Poison Darts
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 15} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 6d4 + 8}) piercing damage, plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Shapechange
entries: The whisperer magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the whisperer's choice).

In a new form, the whisperer retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The whisperer moves up to her speed without causing an opportunity attack.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The whisperer makes an attack.

legendary.name: Breath (3 actions)
entries: The whisperer recharges and use her breath weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marauder is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 26}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). The arcanaloth has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The marauder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The marauder's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Teleport
entries: With a bonus action the marauder magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Preparation
entries: When preparing her spells, the marauder can swap out any spell on her list of prepared spells for another wizard spell of the same level.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: The marauder casts a spell.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The marauder uses teleport

trait.name: Ambush
entries: On the first round of each combat, the mangler has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the hakashu can take the Hide action as a bonus action, merging with the shadows even if there is no cover.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The hakashu can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hakashu makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the attack roll has advantage, the target also takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Flurry of blades {@recharge 4}
entries: The hakashu makes six claw attacks against one target. Either before or after these attacks, it can move up to its speed as a bonus action without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The hakashu halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The king's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Royal Rebuke
entries: Whenever a creature hits the king with an attack it takes {@damage 8} psychic damage.

trait.name: Martial Expert
entries: Any weapon the king wield is considered magic, he also gains the following benefit based on which kind of weapon he wield:
{@b Sovereign Aim}: The king uses Strength to make ranged weapon attacks, doesn't have disadvantage on long range attacks and ignores half and three-quarters cover.
{@b Royal Alacrity}: While dual wielding the king can make two extra attacks as part of his attack action.

{@b Majestic Cleave}: While wielding a heavy weapon the king can reroll any 1 and 2 on his damage rolls with that weapon. Additionally when the king hits a creature with a weapon attack he can use his bonus action to cleave all enemies within 10 feet.
Each enemy makes a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw suffering the same damage of the initial attack, and half as much on a successful save.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king can use its Frightful, Inspiring Presence or Royal Might. It then makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the king's choice that is within 120 feet of the him and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Majestic Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The king send an elemental wave in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity, (or Constitution) saving throw, taking 81 ({@damage 18d8}) fire/ice/lightning/acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Inspiring Presence {@recharge 5}
entries: The king inspire any number of allies within 120 feet of him that are aware of his presence. Each inspired creature gains 40 temporary hit points. Additionally the king's allies have advantage on attack rolls, ability checks and saving throws until the start of the king's next turn.

action.name: Gram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage, plus 28({@damage 8d6}) fire damage.
A creature hit by this attack has disadvantage on all attack rolls until the end of its turn.

action.name: Royal Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 17} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h} 19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) piercing damage, plus 22({@damage 5d8}) ice damage.
A creature hit by this attack has its movement halved until the end of its next turn. If it is a critical attack the targets movement is reduced to 0.

action.name: Twin Crowns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage.
This attack is made with advantage against creatures wearing metal armor. A creature hit by this attack loses its reaction.

action.name: King's Iron Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus 37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) acid damage.
This attack reduce the targets AC by -2 (non cumulative) until the start of the king's next turn.

action.name: Royal Might
entries: The king gains advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks and saving throws until the end of his turn.

reaction.name: Martial Might
entries: When the king is hit by a weapon attack that deals Slashing, Piercing, Bludgeoning damage. He can choose to have immunity to one of those type of damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The king moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The king makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: The king casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellasting
headerEntries: The Hunter's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Distant Strike
entries: On his turn the hunter can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space he can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hunter's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunter can use its Piercing Rain (if available). It then makes three attacks longbow attacks.

action.name: Longbow - Vine Arrow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by vines that burst our of the arrow and take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turn.

action.name: Longbow -  Force Arrow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h} 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) force damage. This attack ignores cover and strong wind.

action.name: Piercing Rain {@recharge 5}
entries: The hunter shoots an arrow or throw a weapon in the air, causing a volley of magic duplicates to fall on a 40-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on that point within 150 feet. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw taking 63 ({@damage 14d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The collector's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

1e: {@spell contingency} (Can prepare spells of any level)

trait.name: Alien Mind
entries: If a creature tries to read the collector's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the collector fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The collector regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the collector takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The collector dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, the collector can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The collector makes one Tentacle Whip attack and uses its Corruption or Cast a Spell once. The collector can replace its Tentacle Whip attack with Extract Brain if it has a creature {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Tentacle Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}), pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the collector, and must succeed on a {@dc 23} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends. The collector can't use the same tentacle whip on another target until this grapple ends. The Collector has two tentacle whips.

action.name: Corruption
entries: The collector targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) necrotic damage and become corrupted for 1 minute.

A corrupted creature's flesh twists in alien ways. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted. The corrupted creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} creature {@condition grappled} by the collector. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the collector kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

legendary.name: Tentacle Whip
entries: The collector makes one attack with its Tentacle Whip.

legendary.name: Spawn Collection (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The collector conjure one creature from his menagerie  in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The creature is under the collector's control and acts immediately after the collector in the initiative order.

legendary.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The collector magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 23} Intelligence saving throw or take 30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Collector casts a spell

spellcasting.name: Subtle Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sorcerer is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21 },  {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks) and doesn't require verbal or somatic components.

trait.name: Shadow Form
entries: The sorcerer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking 5 force damage if he end its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Cantrip Mastery
entries: When the sorcerer casts a cantrip that can target only one creature it can target a second one. Additionally  the sorcerer can cast any cantrip with casting time of action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Quickened Spell (3/day)
entries: When the sorcerer casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, he can spend a bonus action for this casting.

trait.name: Heightened Spell (3/day)
entries: When the sorcerer casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, he can give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sorcerer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 23}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Bound
entries: The giant cannot leave or be forced out of his castle by any means.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Lightning Sword attacks or uses Thunder Javelin twice. And Casts a spell.

action.name: Lightning Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}72 ({@damage 10d8 + 9}) lightning damage.

action.name: Thunder Javelin
entries: The giant coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin is considered a magic weapon and deals 36 ({@damage 8d8 + 9}) thunder damage to the target, striking unerringly.  The target is then pushed 10 feet away from the giant.

action.name: Chain Lightning {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant Casts {@spell chain lightning}

legendary.name: Thunder Hammer (2 Actions)
entries: The giant hurls its Hammer at creature it can see within 120 feet of it creating a shockwave. The target and each creature within 10 feet or if must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. A target takes 75 ({@damage 12d10 + 9}) thunder damage and be pushed up to 20 feet away from the giant on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The giant makes a Lightning Sword or Thunder Javelin Attack.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: The Giant casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bp innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Encantador
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the bp must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bp makes two Due date attacks and uses Eviction Notice once.

action.name: Due date
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +14} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}45 ({@damage 8d8 + 9}) psychic damage.

action.name: Eviction Notice {@recharge 5}
entries: Every creature within 60 feet of the bp must succeed on a {@dc 22} Charisma saving throw be banished to Carceri.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The bp uses its Due Date attack.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: The bp casts a spell.

legendary.name: Eviction Notice (3 actions)
entries: The bp recharges and use its Eviction Notice.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grieving blade's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the grieving blade can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the grieving blade is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grieving blade makes two attacks with its shadow blade or daggers. If either attack hits and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of darkness created by the shadow blade, the grieving blade can dismiss that darkness and cause the target to take ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. The grieving blade can dismiss darkness in this way no more than once per turn.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The grieving blade can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

action.name: Shadow Dagger
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The grieving blade can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Whenever the grieving blade is hit by an attack he can use its reaction to halve the damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Lightning Sword attacks or uses Wind Javelin twice.

action.name: Lightning Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 9d6 + 9}) lightning damage.

action.name: Windjavelin
entries: The giant coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin is considered a magic weapon and deals 19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage to the target, striking unerringly. The javelin disappears after it hits.

legendary.name: Gust
entries: The giant targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates a magical gust of wind around it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction the giant chooses.

legendary.name: Thunderbolt (2 Actions)
entries: The giant hurls a thunderbolt at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: One with the Storm (3 Actions)
entries: The giant vanishes, dispersing itself into the storm surrounding its lair. The giant can end this effect at the start of any of its turns, becoming a giant once more and appearing in any location it chooses within its lair. While dispersed, the giant can't take any actions other than lair actions, and it can't be targeted by attacks, spells, or other effects. The giant can't use this ability outside its lair, nor can it use this ability if another creature is using a control weather spell or similar magic to quell the storm.

To forestall the inevitable, some storm giants approaching the end of their natural life spans seek an escape from death. They plumb the depths of their powerful connection to the elements and disperse themselves into nature, literally transforming into semiconscious storms. The blizzard that rages unendingly around a mountain peak, the vortex that swirls around a remote island, or the thunderstorm that howls ceaselessly up and down a rugged coastline could, in fact, be the undying form of a storm giant clinging to existence.

entries.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: A storm giant quintessent sheds its armor and weapons, but gains the power to form makeshift weapons out of thin air. When the giant has no further use of them, or when the giant dies, its elemental weapons disappear.

entries.name: Forsaken Form
entries: A storm giant quintessent can revert to its true giant form on a whim. The change is temporary but can be maintained long enough for the giant to communicate with a mortal, carry out a short task, or defend its home against aggressors.

entries.name: A Quintessent's Lair
entries: A storm giant quintessent has no need for castles or dungeon lairs. Its lair is usually a secluded region or prominent geographic feature, such as a mountain peak, a great waterfall, a remote island, a fog-shrouded loch, a beautiful coral reef, or a windswept desert bluff. As befits the environment, the storm in which the giant lives could be a blizzard, a typhoon, a thunderstorm, or a sandstorm.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A storm giant quintessent can use lair actions in giant form and while transformed into a storm. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the giant can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the giant can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The giant creates a thunderclap centered on a point anywhere in its lair. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

The giant creates a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog (or murky water within water) centered on a point anywhere in its lair. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The fog lasts until the giant disperses it (no action required), and it can't be dispersed by wind.

The giant creates a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line of strong wind ( or strong current within water) originating from a point anywhere in its lair. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in the direction the wind is blowing. The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in its area. Protected flames, such as those of lanterns, have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a storm giant quintessent's lair is warped by the giant's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: High wind blows within 1 mile of the lair, making it impossible to light a fire unless the location where the fire is lit is protected from the wind.

Rain, snow, or blowing dust or sand (whichever is most appropriate) is constant within 1 mile of the lair. Rain causes rivers and streams to fill or overflow their banks; snow, dust, or sand form deep drifts or dunes.
Flashes of lightning and peals of thunder are continual, day and night, within 5 miles of the lair.

entries: If the giant dies, the lightning, thunder, and high wind regional effects end immediately. Rain, snow, and blowing dust abate gradually within {@dice 1d8} days.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

fluff.name: Ancient Red Dragon

entries: The most covetous of the true dragons, red dragons tirelessly seek to increase their treasure hoards. They are exceptionally vain, even for dragons, and their conceit is reflected in their proud bearing and their disdain for other creatures. The odor of sulfur and pumice surrounds a red dragon, whose swept-back horns and spinal frill define its silhouette. Its beaked snout vents smoke at all times, and its eyes dance with flame when it is angry. Its wings are the longest of any chromatic dragon, and have a blue-black tint along the trailing edge that resembles metal burned blue by fire.

The scales of a red dragon wyrmling are a bright glossy scarlet, turning a dull, deeper red and becoming as thick and strong as metal as the dragon ages. Its pupils also fade as it ages, and the oldest red dragons have eyes that resemble molten lava orbs.

entries.name: Mountain Masters
entries: Red dragons prefer mountainous terrain, badlands, and any other locale where they can perch high and survey their domain. Their preference for mountains brings them into conflict with the hill-dwelling copper dragons from time to time.

entries.name: Arrogant Tyrants
entries: Red dragons fly into destructive rages and act on impulse when angered. They are so ferocious and vengeful that they are regarded as the archetypical evil dragon by many cultures.

No other dragon comes close to the arrogance of the red dragon. These creatures see themselves as kings and emperors, and view the rest of dragonkind as inferior. Believing that they are chosen by Tiamat to rule in her name, red dragons consider the world and every creature in it as theirs to command.

entries.name: Status and Slaves
entries: Red dragons are fiercely territorial and isolationist. However, they yearn to know about events in the wider world, and they make use of lesser creatures as informants, messengers, and spies. They are most interested in news about other red dragons, with which they compete constantly for status.

When it requires servants, a red dragon demands fealty from chaotic evil humanoids. If allegiance isn't forthcoming, it slaughters a tribe's leaders and claims lordship over the survivors. Creatures serving a red dragon live in constant terror of being roasted and eaten for displeasing it. They spend most of their time fawning over the creature in an attempt to stay alive.

entries.name: Obsessive Collectors
entries: Red dragons value wealth above all else, and their treasure hoards are legendary. They covet anything of monetary value, and can often judge the worth of a bauble to within a copper piece at a glance. A red dragon has a special affection for treasure claimed from powerful enemies it has slain, exhibiting that treasure to prove its superiority.

A red dragon knows the value and provenance of every item in its hoard, along with each item's exact location. It might notice the absence of a single coin, igniting its rage as it tracks down and slays the thief without mercy. If the thief can't be found, the dragon goes on a rampage, laying waste to towns and villages in an attempt to sate its wrath.

entries.name: A Red Dragon's Lair
entries: Red dragons lair in high mountains or hills, dwelling in caverns under snow-capped peaks, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized red dragon lairs, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a dragon as it sleeps. With its hoard well protected deep within the lair, a red dragon spends as much of its time outside the mountain as in it. For a red dragon, the great heights of the world are the throne from which it can look out to survey all it controls-and the wider world it seeks to control.
Throughout the lair complex, servants erect monuments to the dragon's power, telling the grim story of its life, the enemies it has slain, and the nations it has conquered.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.
Dragon Age Categories

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Magma erupts from a point on the ground the dragon can see within 120 feet of it, creating a 20-foot-high, 5-foot-radius geyser. Each creature in the geyser's area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A tremor shakes the lair in a 60-foot radius around the dragon. Each creature other than the dragon on the ground in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Volcanic gases form a cloud in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere spreads a round corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a legendary red dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Small earthquakes are common within 6 miles of the dragon's lair.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally warm and tainted by sulfur.
Rocky fissures within 1 mile of the dragon's lair form portals to the Elemental Plane of Fire, allowing creatures of elemental fire into the world to dwell nearby.

entries: If the dragon dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 23}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Bound
entries: The giant cannot leave or be forced out of his castle by any means.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Lightning Sword attacks or uses Thunder Javelin twice. And Casts a spell.

action.name: Lightning Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}72 ({@damage 10d8 + 9}) lightning damage.

action.name: Thunder Javelin
entries: The giant coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin is considered a magic weapon and deals 36 ({@damage 8d8 + 9}) thunder damage to the target, striking unerringly.  The target is then pushed 10 feet away from the giant.

action.name: Chain Lightning {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant Casts {@spell chain lightning}

legendary.name: Thunder Hammer (2 Actions)
entries: The giant hurls its Hammer at creature it can see within 120 feet of it creating a shockwave. The target and each creature within 10 feet or if must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. A target takes 75 ({@damage 12d10 + 9}) thunder damage and be pushed up to 20 feet away from the giant on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The giant makes a Lightning Sword or Thunder Javelin Attack.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: The Giant casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grieving blade's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the grieving blade can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the grieving blade is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grieving blade makes two attacks with its shadow blade or daggers. If either attack hits and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of darkness created by the shadow blade, the grieving blade can dismiss that darkness and cause the target to take ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. The grieving blade can dismiss darkness in this way no more than once per turn.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The grieving blade can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

action.name: Shadow Dagger
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The grieving blade can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Whenever the grieving blade is hit by an attack he can use its reaction to halve the damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Lightning Sword attacks or uses Wind Javelin twice.

action.name: Lightning Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 9d6 + 9}) lightning damage.

action.name: Windjavelin
entries: The giant coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin is considered a magic weapon and deals 19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage to the target, striking unerringly. The javelin disappears after it hits.

legendary.name: Gust
entries: The giant targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates a magical gust of wind around it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction the giant chooses.

legendary.name: Thunderbolt (2 Actions)
entries: The giant hurls a thunderbolt at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: One with the Storm (3 Actions)
entries: The giant vanishes, dispersing itself into the storm surrounding its lair. The giant can end this effect at the start of any of its turns, becoming a giant once more and appearing in any location it chooses within its lair. While dispersed, the giant can't take any actions other than lair actions, and it can't be targeted by attacks, spells, or other effects. The giant can't use this ability outside its lair, nor can it use this ability if another creature is using a control weather spell or similar magic to quell the storm.
